Been to a bad server and got hacked?
Heard all those scary stories about the nasty things that wander the byways of cyberpsace and now you’re spooked?
This is for you.

I’m the dwarf that led the research team at Raeon Industries when they finally broke the upload barrier—the hyperjack in your neck is probably a derivative of my original design. In short, chances are good you’ll never find a better source of wisdom as far as the Hypernet is concerned.

So take my advice and read this document carefully. Some of what you’ve heard or seen is sensationalized but not all, and there’s a great many things on the Hypernet worth being cautious about. An unwary user doesn’t last long, that’s for certain.

Scan it all and keep it in mind—the Hypernet is as dangerous as it is compelling.

In Hypercorps 2099: FAMOTH you’ll find:

Planar rules for the Hypernet and a dozen servers ranging from the old-timey frontier of Maliku to the endless oceans of Aquatica, sprawling forests of the Unyielding Green, curiously medieval Harsanath, and more
Dangers of the Hypernet—whether it’s the dangers of being meat stripped or a viral infection, we’ve got you covered.
Over a dozen creatures and netjackers from the Hypercorps 2099 core rulebook supplemented by new digital assets!
The Netjacker base class for all your hacking, drone-controlling, proxy-possessing needs.
Fourteen class archetypes for technoclerics, cybersurfing monks, digital detectives, and even the dreaded //008 |

212262.name: Impossiball
212262.description:
User Summary

Though view from different perspectives, this is basically Pong! with a lot more balls. There are other features, like shields and slowdowns, but it is basically a high-octane reworking of a back-and-forth game between paddles.

212263.name: The Goblin Shop
212263.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Tenewick’s Shop of Desires is your one-stop shop for weapons, armor, and equipment. If you’re lucky enough, you might even be able to find something magical while you’re here. So step in and begin your visit, and let good old Tenewick meet the desires of your heart!”

Tenewick is a goblin of unique ability. He can get you almost anything you desire...for a small fee, of course. Use the Goblin Shop as a place of easy access for equipment for your characters, or simply as a place to instill hopes and dreams within the characters.

Inside the pages of this book, you will find a description of Tenewick’s Shop of Desires (The Goblin Shop), along with statistics for playing Tenewick, his goblin guards, and his special Servant Warrior Guard. You will also find information on the lands surrounding the Goblin Shop, which will give you a brief glimpse into the World of Suntarynn, the world in which the Questing Heroes Role Playing Game is set.

212264.name: Nightmares on Parade
212264.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs thwarted the Nightmare King’s plans in Pixies on Parade, but the ancient bogeyman despises the idea of losing to mere mortal children. Expending the greater portion of his hoarded strength, he draws all of Glavost into the Dream Realms. There his power is absolute, and the pixie guardians are cut off from the helpless townsfolk. The only ones capable of opposing him are the young champions who defeated his avatar once before and stole a piece of his magic. Can the PCs protect the adults of Glavost from their fears and teach them the power of imagination, or is the town lost in a never ending nightmare?

Nightmares on Parade is an adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and is designed for 4-6 PCs of 7th level, who should reach 8th level by the adventure’s conclusion.

212265.name: Runesmithing Expanded: Equipment Runes
212265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Runesmithing Expanded: Equipment Runes adds to the most iconic feature of the Endzeitgeist Top 10 of 2016 nominee runesmith base class: equipment runes. All runes have one to four power levels, a passive effect (usually), and an activated effect (usually). The biggest runes rival bloodlines in their reach and complexity, and with the new "trap" runes featured in this expansion, perhaps the snarkiness of bloodlines found a new rival, as well.

212266.name: Backwaters
212266.description:
From publisher blurb:

The hero’s life follows a meandering path. Rumors and suspicions often lead the adventurer to remote areas where the only expectation is to encounter the unexpected. In the remote village of Halfstage nemeses encounter each other again. A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 13th level characters. Episode 4 in the Synth Grimsbane Chronicles.

212267.name: Isidra9:  Information Broker Of Two Worlds
212267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Isidra9 came online with the awareness that she was not the first of her kind and that she was patterned on a donor known only as Isidra. For several years she performed those tasks until a human hacker with the handle “Toxic Angel” crashed her supporting systems. Rather than crashing her as well, Toxic Angel spared Isidra and set her free. For another year, she existed in cyberspace as a free AI, avoiding the I-Sec patrols. Adopting the name Isidra9, she put her information-gathering skills to use and was quickly able to trade her talent for credits.

Over time, Isidra9 used her pattern-sorting abilities to identify useful operatives, and she put her amassed credits to work. She started an operation that grew in both power and wealth until she was coordinating teams across the city.

The Character Cache is a collection of characters designed to be used in tabletop RPG gaming, either as character concepts for players or as NPCs/villains by GMs. Artist Matt Morrow illustrates the character pieces, and Encoded Designs writes a system-neutral description, including how to incorporate this character into your campaign. These write-ups also include hooks for encounters and adventure inspiration, plus tags for quick reference.

In addition to the system-neutral write-up are stat blocks for:

Fate Core
Savage Worlds
5e

212268.name: Demon Next Door
212268.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just because you're not out saving the world doesn't mean your life is boring or easy. Civilians, even supernatural ones, have their own struggles to deal with.

This weekend is the big Steel Knights tournament. You've got to settle on your army list, 3D print the minis and paint them. Maybe some judicious use of telepathy will give you insight on the other teams?

You had to fire someone at the store and all his friends quit the same day. You have to rebuild the staff and corporate is watching. Wouldn't it be just the wrong time to be called away because your kid showed off at school and people freaked out?

An off-hand comment about Lovecraft causes a friend to suddenly become angry. When you try to remind her that it's silly to get upset over sci-fi nonsense she pulls down her shirt collar to show you her gills.

Whether you want to play a pure slice-of-life campaign or simply want to add some flavor to the civilians your heroic characters deal with, this book provides useful information.
Included within:

A brief history of The Community and a summary of some of its practices.
A discussion on the lives of civilian Gods and Demons.
Samples of pop culture in the Divine Blood universe ranging from Precious Puppies to cosmetic gene mods.
Gameplay advice on how to focus on making mundane issues into entertainingly absurd situations and obstacles.
Several new sample Advantages and four new playable species suggested by backers and players of the game.

212269.name: Demon Next Door: Day at the Fair
212269.description:
From publisher blurb:

Today's the day of the school's fund-raising fair. Every club has it's own booth up raising money for charity, for club activities or just to show off something they've done recently. You and your friends are set to be this year's best booth at the fair. Nothing will possibly go wrong.

Except the issue someone might have when they're unknowingly not human and about to enter puberty. Or that reporter who's nosing around to make something out of an assignment to a school fair.

Included within:

A basic one-shot scenario with three plot threads.
24 characters which may be used as either pre-generated PCs or NPCs.
Gameplay discussions regarding various kinds of fair booths.
Suggestions for expanding the scenario into a full campaign.

212270.name: Shabono
212270.description:
Shabono takes the players to the rain forest of Venezuela.
The shaman of an Indigenous tribe plays with the village children the popular and traditional Shabono game.

The settlement of the villagers consists of a coherent ring of individual huts, called Shabono. In this central open space of Shabono the children have to prove to the shaman who is the fastest collector among them. At the same time the shaman pours coins from a tree trunk with animal motifs, which the children must collect as quickly as possible.

At Shabono the players perceive the roles of the Indigenous children as well as the tasks of the shaman.
The aim is to collect the animal motifs as quickly as possible and to reach as many points as possible, because the coins have different values.

But the shaman is also guardian of the time and determines by his skill how long the respective collection lasts. In addition, the shaman, with the hand of the "coin of the quick hand", indicates with which hand to be collected.

The game Shabono is played in two rounds. In each round, each player is once a shaman.

In the first round the players must collect coins of an animal motif.

In the second round, the players must collect coins from two different animal motifs. It can happen that two players have to collect the same animal motif. The colored toucan must always be collected by each player.

In the game with the special coins, the players also have the opportunity to influence the game through various actions of the coins.

212271.name: Bella's Mystery Party Game For Kids: The Case of the Stolen Buckle
212271.description:
From back of box: A Complete Mystery Party in a Box! Are your ready to throw the most fun-filled party ever? This will crafted mystery party does all the planning for you. Children dress up and role play outrageously fun characters, play lively games and challenge their logical thinking skills.

Theme:
Come to a Southwestern style cookout with Bella's family and friends after the Tuscon rodeo. Your friend Pedro won first place in bonco busting at the Rodeo and won the coveted buckle. But then while everyone was congratulating him, it vanished and one of you is the thief.

Includes:

2 endings so you can play twice.
Host Guide
Cassette
Real metal buckle
8 Name tags
16 Invitations
20 Scorecards
2 Recipes
3 Secret Clues




Game Play:
Host sends out invitations which describe each guests character along with costume ideas. Kids come to the party dressed rodeo-style and role play one of the 8 suspects. Play the audio tape to hear Bella's narrative. Players make several guesses as to who stole the buckle. In between guesses you can play fun activities. Finally the ending reveals who the thief is. Winner is person who correctly guessed.

212273.name: Trinkets
212273.description:
Description from the publisher:

Trinkets play like Wild tiles, except only YOU can play on your Trinkets! Use these to block the other players. Did I mention they are also immune to Shears and Gum? Trinkets make the game a little bit easier to play. This set includes 24 new tiles (4 tiles in 6 colors).

212274.name: Four Land
212274.description:
Jewels, jewels everywhere! You should utilize limited action with intelligence; consider to make maximum advantage. Compete with others, get all jewels, a few of them, or just monopolize one. Think Craftily, act cleverly, and be the master of the jewels!

A game of card placement and land acquisition for 3-6 players. Have the highest bets on land to claim the jewels.

The object of the game is to collect jewels from Land Plates to meet the victory conditions. Jewels are of different types and values. On your turn, take or bet a number card or token, or take and place land cards and jewels. When a round is complete, players will assess their total numbers of their bets on land cards with the winner taking the jewels. The game ends when a player either has 10 points from one type of jewel or 3 points of value from each different jewel type.

212275.name: Disconnected Ends
212275.description:
Description from the publisher:

Disconnected Ends adds a new aspect to Beardsmith. Having a customer with disconnected beard pieces would bring shame on the whole establishment. To avoid this the Apprentices must work together to reconnect these pieces to the Start Tile. This expansion makes the game a bit more challenging, and a new collaborative mechanic. This set includes 24 new tiles (4 tiles in 6 colors).

212276.name: Bathroom Break
212276.description: When you gotta go, you gotta let the next player take your turn. Unpredictable hilarity ensues when you turn over your Bathroom Break tile and discover that nature is calling loudly! Run for the door and pray that your opponent take too much advantage of you. This set includes 6 new tiles, one for each color.

212277.description:
Description from the back of the box:

Created in the East Belgoff Steam Works as a prototype, the R-100 was seen as a replacement for the foot soldier. With five times the strength of a Rivet and with armor plated skin, there isn't much that can slow down the mechanized warrior. Unfortunately, creating the R100 requires rare alloys and silled clock makers, so they are limited in their deployment. But if you get the chance to field an R100 in your regiment, there won't be a trench line able to stop your forces

This was a Kickstarter Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars
212277.name: Rivet Wars: R-100

212278.description:
Description from the back of the box:
Atomic Robo is a being from another place. He was inadvertently pulled into the world of Rivet when a Blight experiment using unknown energies grew out of control. Now Atomic Robo fights with the allies to defeat the oppressive Blight, but he is always searching for a way back to his own world, where he is also needed to fight tyranny.

This was a KS Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars.
212278.name: Rivet Wars: Atomic Robo

212279.description:
From the back of the box

The Vet fought for his nation, for what he believed in, but he was betrayed by his commanding officer and left for dead. Now he's returned and looking for a little payback. With skills hones from years of fighting in the worst conditions, this Vet can take punishment as good as he dishes it out. When you're in the fight, you better hope the Veteran is on your side

This was a KS Exclusive figure for Rivet Wars
212279.name: Rivet Wars: The Veteran

212280.name: Johtolanka
212280.description:
There has been a robbery! Search the board to find where in Helsinki the robber has hidden the stolen hands of the railway station clock. Get to know the attractions of the Finnish Capital and their location while learning how to read map and coordinates.

This game consists of 24 different cases to investigate. On their turn, the players roll two dice to determine the coordinates and move their pawn on the board accordingly. Each location on board has one of four different symbols which determines the action the player is allowed to perform to collect clues about the location of the stolen item. The game ends when one of the players guesses the location of the item correctly.

212281.description:
Village Attacks is a cooperative castle defence game where players take on the roles of the most infamous creatures of folklore and legend from around the world! Deep in a remote part of the world, you and your monstrous associates have taken up residence in an immense castle. But the local village has had enough of the evil that lies at its door and has decided to lay siege to the castle in an effort to exorcise your wicked taint from the world.
The villagers may be weak, but they are not alone! News of your malevolent presence has spread far and wide; hunters and heroes have come from all corners of the globe to vanquish you! Some have come for the fame, others for the glory, and some even for the reward. But they share a single goal; your doom!
212281.name: Village Attacks
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 040 – Airecon 4

212282.name: Octonauts Memory
212282.description:
Memory - a worldwide classic with awsome octonauts theme
The exciting search for matching picture pairs guarantees hours of fun for thewholefamily!

For 2-6 players from 3 years of age.
Contents: 48 cards (24 pairs)

212283.name: Halloween Hijinks
212283.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween is the only day the pixie protectors of Glavost take off all year, leading it to become a night for mischief. When a young headstrong fairy godmother accidentally releases a wave of wild magic over the town, the poor people all turn into their scary costumes! Can the PCs adjust to their new state quickly enough to keep Glavost from tearing itself apart? Halloween Hijinks is a one-shot family-friendly adventure short for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game suitable for 4-5 5th-level monster PCs.

212284.name: Halloween Horrors
212284.description:
From publisher blurb:

Haunt Your Heroes!

Sometimes what an M&M game needs is a dose of the devilish, a splash of the splattered, or a hint of the horrible. Just in time for Halloween-themed games, Rogue Genius Games takes care of your scary-super-adventure needs with Super Powered Bestiary: Halloween Horrors!

Written and illustrated by the fan-favorite Jacob Blackmon, SPB: Halloween Horrors has six spooky foes, from the carnivorous tree to the scarecrow, ranging from PL 4 to PL 8, perfect for street-level heroes and younger supers, with several variant options scattered throughout.

So take a pass on bank robbers and super-scientists for the season, and let us help you whip up some frightening seasonal scenarios!

212285.name: Sol & Her Colonies
212285.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one page map of near space centered on Sol useable with any sci-fi roleplaying game. The files are JPG and TIFF files at 300dpi and will come out nice and clear during printing.

212286.name: Top Shot Arcade
212286.description:
User Summary
An arcade style shooting gallery collection.

212287.name: Amazons Vs Valkyries: Core Classes
212287.description:
From publisher blurb:

This file covers the six core classes available in the Amazons Vs Valkyries campaign setting. It also outlines all the deities and demigods that faithful characters can turn to for their spells. Five new spells and a new skill - Knowledge (tactics) are also introduced.

Core Classes:

Barbarian - the same one you know and love
Huntress - alt. ranger with no spells
Mystic - new arcane spell caster with several unique powers
Priestess - new divine spell caster with some bard-like abilities
Rogue - basically the same, with 1 new ability
Soldier - alt. fighter with period appropriate training




Skills:

Occultism skill unlocks
New skill for soldiers - Knowledge (tactics)




Deities and their domains:

Asgardian
Celtic
Egyptian
Gaulish
Olympian
Persian
Phoenician
Roman




New Priestess Domains:

Agriculture
Arts
Fertility
Hunting
Lightning
Mirth
Moon
Prophecy




New Spells:

Deadly Jolt
Moonbeam
Storm Cloud
Thunderbolts
Prophetic Vision

212288.name: Rainbow 35
212288.description:
Cards numbered from 1 to 35 are lying out face up. A deck of cards numbered from 1-30 is shuffled and one card is put face up. Whoever points to the corresponding number first wins the card.

Then the next card is revealed etc.

Every card that has been taken by a player and shows the same color as the revealed card raises the number on the revealed card by one. I.e. If Player a already has a yellow card and a yellow 7 is revealed, players have to find the card with the 8 to claim the center card.

Whoever gains 4 cards of the same color or cards with all 7 colours wins.

212289.description: Metal Minerva pawn delivered as a promo in Essen 2016. It replaces the plastic one that comes with the game.
212289.name: 7 Wonders Duel: Pantheon – Metal Minerva Pawn

212290.name: Penny Racers Party: Turbo-Q Speedway
212290.description:
User Summary
The latest entry in the Choro Q CarPG series.

212291.name: Target: Terror
212291.description:
User Summary
Another of the Wii's lightgun shooter games that uses the Wii Zapper.

212292.name: Project Z: Special Operations Team
212292.description:
Contains 8 Soldiers for the Basegame, Rules and new Cards.

This Expansion brings in the new Faction of the Special Operation Forces.
They come with Rules for combat in Buildings.

212293.name: Outdoor Action Double Pack
212293.description:
User Summary
Two games in one compilation.

212294.name: King of Booze
212294.description:
User Summary

Similar to board games like Passout, this video game has players roll the dice and obey instructions for the square they land on. Instructions can range from drinking (most common) to social or physical (including sexual) challenges. The game also keeps track of the drinks consumed and shows a tabulation of drinking safety -- as well as warnings about safe drinking of alcohol -- all in expectation of lawsuits should this game ever become popular.

212295.name: Parakeet
212295.description:
Classic trick-taking perfected in a new deck!

A tropical fruit themed trick-taking card game deck including 2 ways to play:

The standard Parakeet game is for 4 players, with 2 partners. You bid to choose the trump suit. Points are scored by capturing certain point cards, not by counting tricks.

The Fruit Punch alternate rules use the Fruit Punch cards to change the card value orders and trump. The game can be played with 3 to 6 players, everyone for themselves. Points are scored by counting tricks.

212296.name: Klabi
212296.description:
User Summary

A candy-themed platformer aimed at children, in which Klabi, the candy-eating cat, advances through the levels to build a gigantic cake. As of writing, although in full release, this game is rather unfinished and rather buggy.

212297.name: Weapons of the Hill
212297.description: Just when you think you’ve got it all figured out, we throw a monkey wrench into the mix with this awesome expansion for either Queen of the Hill or Little Monsters! Replace existing cards with all-new weapon cards that totally change the meta of the game for veterans of the base set. This expansion features 8 uniquely delicious weapons created from actual legends! What would Excalibur look like if it was a gun? What would Thor’s hammer feel like if it was shaped like a ranged throwing projectile, or even the ultimate golden cudgel of the Monkey God turning into an orbital satellite cannon? Yes, that is how creative this expansion takes it.

212298.name: Magic: The Gathering – Duel Decks: Zendikar vs. Eldrazi
212298.description:
Description from the publisher:

Drawing on the powerful mana that surges through the roiling land, Zendikar’s forces have joined together to defend their plane from the Eldrazi titans. Once trapped for thousands of years, the Eldrazi titans have broken their bonds and now their numberless spawn begin to overrun Zendikar. Contains: 2 Ready-to-play 60-card decks 2 Deck boxes 1 Strategy insert 1 Learn-to-play guide 2 Spin-down counters.

Each card in these two decks is black-bordered and tournament legal. They were designed to be played right out of the box, with no deckbuilding required.

212300.name: Cosmail
212300.description:
Cosmail can be played by 3 to 6 players and 1 game master. Each player has two planes and one ship. The players begin at the starting spaces, numbered I to VI. Movement is determined by the players by spending a set amount of gas (for the planes) or coal (for the ships), which is printed along each travel route. The players may either travel between to neighboring locations or between two locations which are not next to each other, but can be reached by spending a maximum of 24 units gas or 11 units coal.
Gas and coal can be obtained by rolling two dies or by stopping by a location at which gas or coal can be restocked.
The players can obtain merchandise by by flying to a harbor where the wanted merchandise is in stock and file a purchase option with the game master. The next step is to pick up the merchandise with the ship, before an other player too files an option and picks the merchandise up faster.
The players have to pick up 12 different merchandise-cards before they are allowed to obtain gold at one of three possible locations. After obtaining gold, the players return to their starting space. The players may exchange merchandise, gas and coal according to their value.
The first player to return his ship and his planes to his starting space ends and wins the game. The other players win 2nd to 6th place according to the value of their accumulated merchandise, gas, coal and gold.

212301.name: Order of the Gilded Compass: Coveted Artifacts/An Ally Inside expansion
212301.description:
Includes 2 mini-expansions:
- Coveted Artifacts that are mixed in with the Private Artifact tiles.
- Special Agents of the Illuminati that are mixed in the the ability tiles.

212302.name: Order of the Gilded Compass: Tools of Power/Treasure Fragments expansion
212302.description:
Includes 2 mini-expansions:
- 4 "wild" magical items to be mixed in with the others found in the Hidden Temple, and usable by any specialist.
- Goblet Fragments to be mixed in with the others in the Treasure Tower, which are more valuable when both halves are collected

212304.name: Rolemaster Companion Module One (RMC)
212304.description:
From publisher blurb:

ERA (Electronic Roleplaying Assistant) is the ultimate companion for Rolemaster campaigns. Using ERA players can create their characters using a step by step wizard, then level them up and configure all details in stats, skills and special abilities, even overriding the automatic calculations. Afterwards, they can be added to a running campaign in the adventuring module. From there, the game master can control all aspects of the game: resolve maneuvers, resistances, resting, and of course, spell casting and combat.

With ERA you can create Rolemaster characters and then manage their adventures. Players can also monitor their characters from their mobile devices as the action progresses. But no adventure is complete without some gritty combat. Blows must be dealt, and damage resolved. In the free base ERA product you will find 2 sample weapons and 3 critical tables.

Rolemaster Companion I has a lot to offer. Get it and add to ERA: 8 professions, 22 races, 104 background option descriptions, 34 spell lists, 117 individual spells, 41 herbs and 34 creature templates!

Heal and smite with the holy power of a paladin, sneak under the magical shadows of the nightblade, or smash everything with a mighty barbarian.
The new background options offer both skills at arms and skills at magic. A Master Tactician, or a Shapechanger, among others, are now possible.
The races in this package will allow variant elves, halflings, mannish tribes, and half-breeds from dwarves to trolls.
Give the herbalists in the party the reward they deserve: Tharm for their long journeys under the sun, and some Carneyar to be healed after a though combat.
Arcane magic is now at your disposal. And druidic magic. And assassination spells. And crafting-enhancement powers. And just in case, more than a hundred individual spells with complete descriptions, from a simple Mental Grasp to the devastating power of Hellfrost.
This package is not all about the heroes. All creatures in RMC Companion I are included, ready to be used as templates to drop as NPCs in your adventure. This means Carnivorous Flying Monkeys are an option. Also Black Unicorns. But it is easier just to call for a Black Reaver, and let it walk. Click, click.

212306.name: Future Wars - (Issue 26)
rpgissuearticle: Clan Trials of Position: 1.  Clan Wolf
Clan Trials of Position: 2. Clan Jade Falcon (Trueborn)
Clan Trials of Position: 3. Clan Jade Falcon (Freeborn)
New Mech: MRN-1 STR Morning Star
Review M3 Miniatures and Citadel Tanks
Review: More Tales of the Black Widow
The Clans vs. Inner Sphere: Elio's Eliminators
The Kin vs. The Clans: 1. Delaying Action on Kala
The Kin vs. The Clans: 2. Kala Deathduel
The Kin vs. The Clans: 3. Counter-Attack

212307.name: Lizard People: Lords of the Media
212307.description:
Gameplay is simple - think word poker! Each round, one player is the editor, and the rest are writers. The editor plays 3 cards from their hand - this is called the topic. Writers must then play cards from their hand, using at least 2 of the topic cards, to create a headline. When you've got a headline you like, you may pitch it, then read it out.

The Pitch: Before reading your headline, you may catch everyone up to speed on current events or the context of your headline. This may be how you sway the editor so think about your pitch!

The Headline: Then, you play the cards from your hand that you're using, and read the headline - you're allowed to add punctuation to your headline that doesn't appear on the cards.

Once every writer has read their headline, the editor chooses which to publish, and awards that player with a people part.

If you can build a whole human body, you win!

212308.name: The Space Patrol
212308.description:
From publisher blurb:

The SPACE PATROL Needs YOU!

The Space Patrol! Help protect innocent lives from the scourge of space piracy! Fight interstellar crime! Let the Navy play its wargames, the real action is in the merchant lanes with the Space Patrol. Join the galaxy’s elite crime fighting organization now!

The Space Patrol is a supplement for the Cepheus Engine rules and 2D6 SciFi OGL games. This book contains complete rules for creating Space Patrol characters with four detailed careers - complete with expanded event and mishap tables - expanded world descriptions discussing legal codes and interstellar law, a complete description of the Space Patrol’s organization, as well as its standard equipment. Busy GMs will find dozens of NPCs from all Divisions of the Space Patrol, as well as some of the Sub-Sector’s most notorious criminals. But beware: if these villains were easy to catch, they would already be behind bars.

The Space Patrol book includes complete descriptions of the ships used by the Patrol, from the humble Cutter to the mighty Ballista-Class Frigate. It provides extended details and full deck-plans for three ships - the 100-ton Relentless-Class Pursuit Ship; the 200-ton TL 12 Tasman-Class Q-Ship; and the 400-ton Dragon-Class Corvette.

212309.name: The Dracula Dossier Deck
212309.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deal yourself into danger with the Dracula Dossier Deck! NPCs, Nodes, Locations, Objects, and Opponents get lushly illustrated cards. Pass them out as handouts, pin them to the Adversary Map! Spread them like tarots, shuffle up random encounters, deal out a full Conspyramid, or draw for wandering Dukes - the Dracula Dossier Deck adds still more improvisation to your game!

212310.name: Pick Your Poison
212310.description:
Everything good comes at a cost. What are you willing to live with? Win by playing your best perk and poisoning your neighbors.

Each round of play starts by choosing a judge. The remaining players will play a perk face-down(a white card that contains "good stuff") that they think the judge will like. After every player plays a perk, the players continue to play poisons face-down (a green card that conversely contains "bad stuff") on their neighbor's perks.

After everyone has played their cards, it's time for the judge to read all the choices aloud and pick his poison! The winning perk gets a point and play continues by rotating the role of the judge.

212312.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition) – Ghosts of Harrenhal
212312.description:
Description from the publisher:

Enter your own name in contention for this cursed stronghold of Harrenhal with the Ghosts of Harrenhal Chapter Pack for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. As the War of the Five Kings has touched every corner of Westeros, you'll find new cards in this expansion that interact with the King trait, while other cards help you counter the drastic bloodshed of Valar Morghulis. Finally, you'll encounter a host of iconic characters in this Chapter Pack, including Roose Bolton, Brienne of Tarth, Craster, Ser Davos Seaworth, Joffrey Baratheon, and Myrcella Baratheon.

212314.name: Eyes in the Snow
212314.description:
From the introduction:

Your group of travellers have set out in the dead of winter, hoping to reach Waterdeep from Daggerford. Unfortunately, a snowstorm has made progress difficult, and travel along the high road may spell your doom, unless you can find a place to shelter for the night. And to make matters worse, you are being watched.

User summary:

For 1st level characters.

212315.name: Mildew's Revenge
212315.description:
From the introduction:

There has never been a bard quite like Manic Mildew. Whether commoners, nobles, or farm animals, folks of every size, shape, and flavor flocked to Mildew’s performances in staggering numbers. His untimely death at the height of his career left a void that has gone unfilled since. Not for lack of trying, mind you. In the two hundred years since his passing, there has been no shortage of usurpers, posers, and braggarts willing to try their hand at dethroning the king of comedy. Oddly, those with any real hope of succeeding have vanished before getting their big break. Common wisdom writes off these disappearances as the undisciplined whims of creative types. Those in the know, however, have no doubt. It’s the ghost of Manic Mildew. It’s the maestro himself making sure no one ever outshines him.

212316.name: Friends Like These
212316.description:
Description from the publisher:

Time is running out for an important ally in Friends Like These, an adventure supplement for the Star Wars: Age of Rebellion roleplaying game. When intelligence reveals that an important and secret shipyard is under threat, the player characters have two days to arrange the planet’s defense and recruit allies in the region before Imperial forces arrive. Friends Like These takes players to a new sector where they encounter Mandalorian culture and face a brutal moral decision regarding who the Rebel Alliance should call friends.

212317.name: Star Wars: Armada – Phoenix Home Expansion Pack
212317.description:
Description from the publisher:

Under the command of Jun Sato, the Phoenix Home was the nerve center of the fledgling Rebel fleet, and it makes its way to Star Wars: Armada in the Phoenix Home Expansion Pack. What this small-base ship lacks in size and firepower, it makes up with its ability to command your fleet. Along with one pre-painted miniature starship, you will find two ship cards, ten upgrade cards, and all the dials, bases, pegs, and tokens you need to control the battle, more effectively coordinating your capital ships and fighter squadrons alike.

212318.name: Star Wars: Armada – Imperial Light Cruiser Expansion Pack
212318.description:
Description from the publisher:

As seen in the Star Wars Rebels television show, the Imperial light cruiser is a communications and blockade ship used to help the Empire spread its domain throughout the galaxy. In Star Wars: Armada, the Imperial Light Cruiser Expansion Pack presents this ship as a fast, small-base Imperial vessel that excels at providing long-range fire support from its broadsides. With its ship, its two ship cards, eight upgrades, and all requisite accessories, the Imperial Light Cruiser Expansion Pack will have you racing around the Rebels’ flanks and into a new era for Imperial tactics!

212319.name: Into the Bayou
212319.description:
(publisher blurb)

Into the Bayou takes you out of the city and into the bogs, fens, and marshes east of Malifaux City. This Malifaux supplement for Through the Breach expands on the options presented in the Fated Almanac, allowing players access to the ramshackle weapons and strange magic of the Bayou's race of green-skinned Gremlins.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212320.name: Shockwave
212320.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The House of Al'Zarif would like a brave group of adventurers to enter the Bramblewood Gap to negotiate with the wild elves, but can they be trusted? Care to try your luck at some diplomacy with some noted xenophobes?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212321.name: Fish Out of Water
212321.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The dwarves of the Yatil Mountains usually take care of their own problems. Now they are asking for help and nobody seems to know why...

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212322.name: Treasure Hunt
212322.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The treasure of Arad Darkeye lies hidden in the dark reaches of the Bramblewood. What does it take to retrieve it and survive?

User summary:

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212323.name: Diamonds in the Rough
212323.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The last few days of travel on the road out of Polvar City have been rainy and unpleasant. Good thing there is an Inn up ahead. It marks the entrance into the Sarshon Shire. Could there be trouble in Sarshon? If so, then it must be a Godsday.

Part One of the Ride in the Country series.

It's worth the ride to Sarshon.

An adventure for characters level 3 - 8.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212324.name: Valley of the Lost
212324.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

While wandering the bazaar in Molvar, you hear the call of a town crier. Apparently a mullah from a local temple of Al'Akbar has asked for the assistance of adventurers in searching for his missing son. What dangers may await in the Yatil Mountains as you search for the lost?

An adventure for characters level 3 - 10.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212325.name: Lowest of the Low
212325.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

What is the cost, if innocence is ignored? Of course in Ket, what does innocence truly mean? Come to the village of Yern in Polvar Province and ask around for yourself. Be sure to look for a bargain in the bazaar.

An adventure for characters level 1 - 6.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212326.name: And Battles to be Won
212326.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Tusman Hills are home to some very independent and difficult tribesmen with some odd practices. How much will you risk to help free some captives from their control?

An adventure for characters level 1 - 8.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212327.name: Into Thin Air
212327.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A newborn baby is a time for joy and celebration. Great Heroes like Arad Darkeye come out to kiss them and shake hands. But for each new birth, terror and silent conspiracy have brought death. Praise the goals of the future, for the tasks of the past are unspeakable.

A Two Round adventure for [character levels] 4 - 8.

Part One of the Things Best Forgotten Series.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212328.name: Sneers of the Mind: Redux
212328.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Sometimes conjuring bunny rabbits just isn’t enough. Sometimes, you look to places you shouldn’t, for knowledge that was never meant for mortal minds. A tale of horror for the strong of mind.

A One Round Adventure for [character levels] 2 - 8.

Part One of the Altered Perceptions Series.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212329.name: Broken Faith
212329.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

There is trouble near the Yatil Mountains and the local Bey has had his hands full routing a nest of undead that have been unearthed. Just when the locals thought they had it under control, a local inventor goes missing. Now the Archons and Elite Threshers known as the ‘Black Scorpions’ have become involved and you seem to have become the middlemen. Who’s pulling the strings and what does this mean for Ket?

A One Round adventure for the unselfish from [character levels] 6 - 12.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212330.name: Burned Flour in High Dough
212330.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

In Molvar City, a man disappears without a trace. Has he gone on another drinking spree as he often does, or is something more sinister afoot? It’s probably nothing, but have you got anything better to do? I thought not.

An adventure for [character levels] 2 - 6.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212331.name: Bounty Hunt
212331.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

The Irafa Road cuts through some of the most dangerous regions within the Bramblewood. At one end, the heartland of Ket and at the other, the annexed lands of northern Bissel. What happens when something valuable to both gets misplaced within the treacherous wood? It can't be good for anyone. The Bramblewood is never for the feint of heart.

A One Round adventure for [character levels] 8 - 12.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212332.name: Secrets of the Past
212332.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Just outside of Polvar, a Baklunish archaelogist is excavating a ruin and needs some equipment delivered. It should be a routine trip, to earn a bit of extra spending money and see the countryside.

An introductory adventure for level 1 characters only.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212333.name: Choices
212333.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Life is matter of choices, for those who choose to adventure in Ket these choices can often be very difficult as can the consequences.

An introductory adventure for level 1 characters only.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212334.name: Do You Take This Man
212334.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A long hard trek to the northeastern reaches of Ket ends in song, dance, and the celebration of Kettite culture. And with a wedding in the works, how much trouble could you possibly find?

An introductory adventure for 1st level characters.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212335.name: On the Road Again
212335.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A trip down the Irafa Road becomes all the more interesting as you "volunteer" to help a lieutenant in the Kaman, the light cavalry of Ket.

An introductory adventure for 1st level characters only.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212336.name: Best Man for the Job
212336.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Introductory Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A young Baklunish girl wants to be the new groundskeeper at Rary's Tower. Can you help her prove she's the "best man for the job"?

A one-round Introductory module for 1st-level characters.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212337.name: Old Man Mullah Had a Shrine
212337.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Introductory Adventure

From the introduction:

An old man needs young blood to tend to the temple garden. Things are never what they seem. Or are they? A shopping expedition for new adventurers starting their career in the city of Molvar.

Playable only by 1st level characters.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212338.name: The Rescue of Sanjar "the Low"
212338.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Giant folk have been seen taking pilgrims into the Yatils. Mullahs are frantic for help. Are you brave enough to mount a rescue to free those kidnapped?

An adventure set for [characters level] 4 - 10.

This adventure is the sequel to KET3-01: Lowest of the Low and second in the “Good vs Evil” series.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212339.name: That Which Remains
212339.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A lady in need seeks your help. Strange things are happening in her village and you may be the only ones who can find out the truth. Will you answer her call?

An adventure for [characters level] 2 - 6.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212340.name: Double Dog Dare
212340.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

An old adventurer has a challenge for you but doesn’t think you’re up to the task. Can you prove him wrong or will you die trying?

An adventure for [characters level] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212341.name: Water the Meadows
212341.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Farmers produce the food that Ket needs to live and thrive. Now, what could possibly make them want to stop and take up another livelihood?

An adventure for those with moral conviction from [characters level] 2 - 12.

Part One of the Foundations series.

212342.name: Oracle
rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212342.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

A reclusive sage wants the adventurers to seek out a long lost oracle, located deep under the roots of the mountains, and consult its ancient knowledge.

An adventure for [characters level] 2 - 12.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212343.name: At the Feet of the Dragon
212343.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Borders come and borders go but nomads still roam the Plains of the Paynim south of Ket, sometimes venturing into the Tusman Hills themselves. Do you dare to brave an area claimed by the tribes and see what you can find out about their future or their past...

An adventure for the fleet of foot and stout of heart from [characters level] 2 - 12.

Part One of the Heritage series.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212344.name: The Darkeye Hour
212344.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Arad Darkeye is ready to return to the Beygraf’s service. Yet old enemies jealously await to spoil the national celebration. The consequences could lead to Ket’s darkest hour.

Part four in the "Darkeye of Ket" series.

An adventure for [characters level] 8 - 12.

rpgseries: KET - Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventures
212345.name: Ruin
212345.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Ket Regional Adventure

From the introduction:

Rumor of the discovery of an ancient temple near the village of Masha’a has spread like wildfire and drawn many adventurers North to investigate. Will you brave the unknown and emerge with riches and fame? Or will you find only doom? Be sure to meet with old friends... and don’t forget to write.

An Adventure for [characters level] 2 - 12.

Part One of the Revelations Series

boardgameintegration: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
212346.description:
Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress is a brand new dungeon crawl adventure boardgame in the Shadows of Brimstone series. It can either be played on its own, as a stand-alone game, or it can be used in combination with any and all of the other Shadows of Brimstone products! It is fully compatible, in every way!

Players take on the role of courageous Heroes, fighting back a tide of evil creatures and demons that have invaded their world! Play as the stalwart Samurai Warrior, using your mastery of the Katana and your bushido code of honor to defeat your foes in combat, the nimble and deadly ninja Assassin, using stealth and speed as weapons, the Traveling Monk, a member of an ancient Yamabushi order devoted to fighting supernatural creatures wherever they may be found, and the powerful and mystic Sorceress, who wields Elemental Magik to crush her enemies

Set in Feudal Japan, the Heroes must brave the Forbidden Fortress; a feudal castle overrun with all manner of Demons, Ghosts, and Monsters inspired by Japanese myth and legend. The massive Oni, red beast-like ogres wielding giant clubs, stalk the halls, while deadly Tengu sword masters descend from the skies with their raven wings to attack the Heroes. Legions of Samurai Dishonored Dead rise from the grave, and writhing Acidic Tentacles burst from the floor to spit acid and feed on the Heroes with their razor sharp teeth. But at the heart of the fortress lie the most terrifying and epic foes of all; the Harionago, a ghostly, demonic woman, held aloft by the twisting strands of her animated hair, which is also used to entangle and slash at the Heroes with its vicious barbs, and the towering Living Statue, possessed by Darkness to break away from its posts, wreaking havoc and smashing the castle it was once built to protect!

Game Features

Includes 27 multi piece hard plastic, 32mm scale game miniatures for the Heroes and Enemies.
Immersive adventures and story driven gameplay, using the Shadows of Brimstone™ Game Engine.
Fully Cooperative, with all of the players working together against the game itself
Dynamically generated adventures, 12 different Missions, and 4 unique Heroes with many options for customization, the game is designed for massive replayability.
Built-in Campaign system for keeping your Hero characters from game to game, finding new items on your adventures and gaining new skills and abilities as you go up in level.
Heroes visit a Feudal Japanese Village between mission to re-stock and re-supply before the next adventure, having a mini-adventure in town.
Double-sided Map Tiles include a Japanese Fortress on one side and the Belly of the Beast OtherWorld on the back side for the Heroes to explore; stepping through a shimmering portal and continuing their adventures in an alien world inside of a massive living creature.
Over 250 game cards, a full set of beautifully illustrated, double-sided Map Tiles, a host of dice and counters, and all of the large Hero and Enemy record sheets needed to play
Includes a CD Soundtrack of original Music, created to set the mood while playing.

Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress can be played on its own as a stand-alone game, or it can be used in combination with any and all of the other Shadows of Brimstone products already available! It is fully compatible, in every way! For new players, Forbidden Fortress will make a great introduction to the world of Shadows of Brimstone, and for veteran players, it adds a ton of new content, including two brand new Worlds to explore - the Japanese castles and temples of the Forbidden Fortress and a living world inside a massive creature in the Belly of the Beast. It also includes a brand new set of Heroes and Enemies to add to your games. With the option of starting your Heroes in Feudal Japan or the Old West, or having a mixed party of Heroes, drawn from both worlds, the possibilities are endless!
212346.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Forbidden Fortress

212347.name: Oft Horizon
212347.description:
The Age of Exploration comes alive with beautiful detail in Oft Horizon, as you sail your vessels across a procedurally generated archipelago enduring storms and surviving naval battles.

Source: The Developer Website.

212348.name: Mined Out!
boardgamepodcastepisode: 27. Devon Dice Podcast: The Balancing Act: Assassins, Beasts, Children, Designers
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 033 – Great Western Trail vs The Oracle of Delphi
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 038 – Jamaica vs Thunder Alley vs Race! Formula 90
212348.description:
In Mined Out! players explore their own individual mines, collecting gems, building upgrades, installing supports, and throwing dynamite in order to emerge as victor.

Players score points for preventing cave-ins, collecting gems of different values, and building upgrades - which give them tactical advantages to help them win the game.

Once one player has installed all of their upgrades, the game ends immediately, and players score up their mines.

A pocket-sized game with billions of potential mine combinations and plenty of different strategies, Mined Out! is a well-balanced, family-friendly game to suit players of all levels.

212349.name: Biblisches Namino
212349.description:
A simple tile placement game in which players score points for completing biblical names. Each edge of the tile has letters printed on them, e.g. "Je", "richo", that is part of a name. In turn order players draw one or two random tiles and place them adjacent to the tiles on the table. Each completed name gives one point.

Their is a longer variant in which players might only place one tile per turn. Another variant awards players up to 3 additional points per name, if they can tell up to 3 sentences about the name.

212350.name: Star Wars: Armada – Rebel Fighter Squadrons II Expansion Pack
212350.description:
Description from the publisher:

Rebel pilots are masters of improvisation, and you can bring their talents to your games of Star Wars: Armada with the Rebel Fighter Squadrons II Expansion Pack. The venerable Z-95 Headhunter, agile Lancer-class Pursuit Craft, and sturdy VCX-100 Freighter lend new strength and tactics to your fleet, helping you win even the most desperate of battles. Together with the advanced E-wing fighter, these crafts add firepower and versatility to your Rebel forces, and their pilots carry the hopes of freedom for a beleaguered galaxy!

212351.name: Star Wars: Armada – Imperial Fighter Squadrons II Expansion Pack
212351.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Empire's most advanced attack craft bring monstrous power into battle in the Imperial Fighter Squadrons II Expansion Pack for Star Wars: Armada. Elusive TIE Phantoms ambush Rebel squadrons, while elite TIE Defenders outmatch the enemy with fearsome capabilities, and hulking VT-49 Decimators leave only wreckage in their wake. Supported by the coordination ability of Lambda-class shuttles, these eight miniature squadrons and eight squadron cards work hard to crush the Rebel opposition.

212352.name: Hunger in the Void
212352.description:
(publisher blurb)

The Void Hungers

The world of Urth and the entire universe stand in the shadow of a dread power, a force of destruction beyond imagining. The Demon Lord, also called the Hunger in the Void, the Devourer in the Dark, and the One Foretold, draws nearer to the world, causing plagues and blights, war and upheaval, all of which harken the end times. In this supplement for Shadow of the Demon Lord, the Demon Lord and its obscene legions are revealed in all their awful glory. In these foul pages, you’ll find:

Campaign models incorporating the various shadows of the Demon Lord
Details on eight vile cults sworn to serving the Demon Lord
Rules for joining and serving these cults, including the priest of the Demon Lord novice path
A selection of horrible spells used by the servants of darkness
Expanded information on the beastmen, including rules for creating beastmen characters
Extensive rules for building and customizing demons
Statistics for the dreaded demon princes, the chief servants of the Demon Lord
Rules for exploring the Void and what sorts of terrible things one might find there
The incarnation ancestry, body snatchers who descend to the world to fight against the Hunger in the Void

The Hunger in the Void shines a light on the most terrifying creatures and most dangerous threat in the game. For the terrible secrets it reveals and the bevy of new and unnerving options it offers, The Hunger in the Void is an essential supplement for Shadow of the Demon Lord.

212353.name: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 2: World of Tomorrow
212353.description:
Hitman is an episodic action-adventure stealth video game. It is the sixth entry in the Hitman series. While the game's prologue acts as a prequel to the series, the main game takes place 7 years after the events of Hitman: Absolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitman_%282016_video_game%29 Hitman (2016 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

212354.name: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 3: A Gilded Cage
212354.description:
Hitman is an episodic action-adventure stealth video game. It is the sixth entry in the Hitman series. While the game's prologue acts as a prequel to the series, the main game takes place 7 years after the events of Hitman: Absolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitman_%282016_video_game%29 Hitman (2016 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

212355.name: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 4: Club 27
212355.description:
Hitman is an episodic action-adventure stealth video game. It is the sixth entry in the Hitman series. While the game's prologue acts as a prequel to the series, the main game takes place 7 years after the events of Hitman: Absolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitman_%282016_video_game%29 Hitman (2016 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

212356.name: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 5: Freedom Fighters
212356.description:
Hitman is an episodic action-adventure stealth video game. It is the sixth entry in the Hitman series. While the game's prologue acts as a prequel to the series, the main game takes place 7 years after the events of Hitman: Absolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitman_%282016_video_game%29 Hitman (2016 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

212357.name: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 6: Hokkaido
212357.description:
Hitman is an episodic action-adventure stealth video game. It is the sixth entry in the Hitman series. While the game's prologue acts as a prequel to the series, the main game takes place 7 years after the events of Hitman: Absolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hitman_%282016_video_game%29 Hitman (2016 video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

212358.name: Creepy Castle
212358.description:
User Summary

A conspiracy is welling deep within the stone walls of an ancient castle.

212359.name: MegaRats
212359.description:
Defend the city and save Earth. Showcasing some of the latest capabilities from Red Frizbee Studios, Mega Rats is a fun filled and carefully crafted mix of fluid physical motion and breathtaking 3D stylized photo-realistic graphics.

Source: The Developer Website.

212360.name: Draconic Order VR
212360.description:
Virtual Reality RPG Survival game for the HTC Vive! Learn of your lineage, and fulfill your destiny. You must reignite the flames of war once more. Discover mysterious tomes, written in different race's native tongue. Learn powerful spells, and summon legendary Guardians to aide you in Battle.

Source: The Game Website.

212361.name: Mosaic: Game of Gods
212361.description:
Mosaic: Game of Gods is a game of mosaic puzzles made of different materials. The Universe exists balancing between Chaos and Creation. They bring harmony and equilibrium; they are watching the flow of life. But, when one of the forces prevails, the world becomes unrecognizable.

Source: The Developer Website.

212362.name: VR RunningJoe
212362.description:
User Summary

Running Joe is a racing game.

212363.name: The Sims 4 - City Living
212363.description:
User Summary

Players get new indoor activities like apartment decorating and having a good time with friends. For the outdoorsy type, there are activities to do while on the streets as well.

212364.name: Above: VR
212364.description:
User Summary

Above is a virtual experience that place the player in the position of a stranded astronaut in space.

212365.name: Heroes of Issachar
212365.description:
Heroes of Issachar is a city-builder / FPS hybrid. This game takes everything you love about classic city-builders and puts a crossbow in your hand to defend the kingdom you have built and extinguish the enemy from the land by raising up an army and recruiting other heroes to join the fight.

Source: The Developer Website.

212366.name: BlazBlue: Central Fiction
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Mutliplayer Experience of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
212366.description:
It is the fourth game to the BlazBlue series, and is set after the events of BlazBlue: Chrono Phantasma.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BlazBlue%3A_Central_Fiction BlazBlue: Central Fiction]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

212367.name: Gravity+
212367.description:
Gravity+ is a puzzle game suitable for all ages. You play a small robot on a space station and you have to find your way through a maze to the exit. You are able to manipulate gravity to make your way through traps and hazards. The game features over two dozen stages.

Source: The Publisher Website.

212368.name: Pinball Breakout
212368.description:
Pinball Breakout is a breakout game for one or two players combining game mechanics from a traditional breakout game and a flipper game.

Source: The Publisher Website.

212369.name: Twisted Fusion
212369.description:
User Summary

Join Cora, our dual water-gun wielding heroine on a epic adventure in this unique open world platformer.

212370.description:
Description from the publisher:

Omen: Edge of the Aegean is a stand alone, two player card game, with the same mechanics, theme, and setting of Omen: A Reign of War.

As half-god children of Zeus, the players are bent on ruling all of Greece. With the blessings of the gods, they wage war over 3 cities to prove who is the more powerful warlord.

Each City contains 2 random Reward cards. Players play powerful Unit cards from their hand to these Cities, and once a certain number of Units are in the City, the player with the most Strength gains 1 of the reward cards in that City.

There are 4 different Unit types in Omen: Edge of the Aegean: Myrmidons, Keres, Automatons, and Moirai. Each different Unit can be used different ways, and each offers a unique effect on the game.

Players score points for the Rewards they've won, cards they've Exalted, and certain cards in hand.

While Omen: Edge of the Aegean is a stand alone game, the cards included in this game can be used with Omen: A Reign of War.
212370.name: Omen: Edge of the Aegean

212371.name: Ice Station Z
212371.description:
After a strange virus spreads across an Arctic island you are left alone to survive. Scavenge for food, drink, medical supplies, weapons, ammunition, clothes, fuel and other useful equipment. Find shelters, vehicles and other interesting locations to help you survive during day and night.

Source: [http://www.nintendo.com/games/detail/ice-station-z-3ds# The Publisher Website].

212372.name: Dungeon Rats
212372.description:
Dungeon Rats is a turn-based, party-based RPG set in the Age of Decadence world and focused on squad level tactical combat. If fighting your way out of a prison mine - and frequently dying in the attempt - is your idea of a good time, you've come to the right place.

Source: The Developer Website.

212373.name: The Stargazers
212373.description:
The Stargazers squadron! Three pilots of the Allied Defense Force Signals, first to arrive in any new frontier, their mission? Venture deep into uncharted space and explore the hell out of it!

Source: The Developer Website.

212374.name: Memory's Dogma CODE:01
212374.description:
User Summary

Japan, 2030 A.D. Memories can now be digitized and archived, allowing people to communicate with the deceased.

212376.name: Stroop
212376.description:
Stroop is a real-time observation game based on the psychological Stroop Effect, which is a phenomenon caused by different functions of the brain interfering with one another.

The cards in Stroop each display a single word. The words are printed in several colors (white, red, blue, and yellow), sizes (big and little), and styles (hollow and solid), and they have different numbers of letters (three, four, five, and six). The challenge is to read one word and quickly match it with the description of another word — without regard to what the second word says.

In the first round of the game, players are dealt an equal number of cards, and a card is turned face-up in the center of the table, forming the base of a pile. Players then race to find a card in their deck that the center card describes, and place this on top of the pile, changing the center card. Play continues until one player runs out of cards.

The second round of the game is similar to the first, except that the rule for eligible cards to play is reversed: now a card may be played only if its text describes the qualities of the card in the center. The player with the fewest cards remaining wins.

212378.name: Dragon Pets
212378.description:
Nobody said being a dragon breeder was easy… and the competition is heating up! You have two fine specimens to start with. All you need to do is send your Dragon Seekers out into the forest to find a suitable match. But there are other breeders trying to grab the best dragons before you can: The 1783rd annual dragon breeding competition is about to begin. Can you outwit your rivals and claim the title of Supreme Dragon Breeder?

Object of the Game
You begin the game with two dragons in search of mates. You must send your Dragon Seekers into the forest to collect more dragons, forming mating pairs. Each pair you collect will award you gold coins. The player with the most coins at the end of the game wins!

212379.name: Boss Monster: Reactor Core
212379.description:
Reactor Core (Trap Room) was handed out to visitors of Brotherwise Games booth at Origins 2016.

Card Text:
Advanced Rooms in your dungeon have +1 Heart.
Value of 2 Hearts.

The Reactor Core is a room that can be added to the deck of rooms for the Boss Monster base game.

212380.name: Garret's Guide to the Undead
212380.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you want to fight the undead?

We introduced The Holy Knight to rid the world of evil in the name of the gods. But even a blessed warrior of all things good and pure needs a bit of tactical help every now and then.

Garret's Guide to the Undead is the first guide pulled together from the notes of Sir Garret Thom. Without Sir Thom, the civilized world would have been much darker and under the yoke of its vampiric oppressors. His followers saw fit to pull his wisdom together for future generations of knights.

Garret's Guide to the Undead details nine different types of undead as well as some rumors and theories that may have slipped in over the years. Use this content as a player or referee (GM) for your Mazes & Perils campaign or adapt it for use with your favorite OSR fantasy system.

212381.name: Dice Poker
212381.description:
The object of the game is for a player or team of players to line up five chips in a row on the board to form a "run". The first player or team to create two runs wins!

How to Play: A player begins his turn by rolling all five dice. The combination of the dice facing up is to be read like cards in a poker hand. Viable hands include full house, straight, five of a kind, four of a kind, three of a kind, two pairs and one pair.

A player may throw the dice once, twice or up to three times to roll the best possible combination. After their first roll, a player can roll again anything from one to five of the dice. On your second and third rolls you can again roll one to five of the dice, including re-rolling anything you had set aside in the first roll. After the third roll place a poker chip of your team color on the board that corresponds to the poker hand combination of dice. Then the next player to the left rolls the five dice to start their turn.

If the squares of the board corresponding to the dice combination rolled is already covered by a chip, then that player's turn is over and they cannot play a chip on the game board. Note: there are usually two of each possible combination on the board.

When a player or team places five chips in a row on the board this constitutes a run. Chips in a run are protected during the remainder of the game. A player's run may share common chips with their other runs, however, a player cannot claim a new run by adding chips to the end of an established run. A new run must contain at least 4 chips not in common with the original run.

The first player or team to create two runs on the board wins.

Special Rules:
The center square on the game board that can be used by all players as part of a run, but cannot be claimed by any one player.

Lucky 7: Anytime a player rolls a combination of the five dice so that the face value adds up to seven a player has the option to place a chip on either Luck 7 or whatever other combination appears on the dice (full house, three of a kind, etc).

Lucky 11: Anytime a player rolls a combination of the five dice so that the face value adds up to eleven a player has the option to place a chip on either Luck 11 or whatever other combination appears on the dice (full house, three of a kind, etc).

Five of a Kind: Anytime a player rolls a five of a kind that player may place their chip on ANY open square on the game board. Wild!

Bouncer: After all the "straight" squares on the game board are filled, every time you roll another straight the results is a "bouncer". A bouncer allows the player to remove any one opponents chip from game board except a chip that has been placed in an already completed run.

After all the "full house" squares on the game board are filled, every time you roll another straight the results is a "bouncer". A bouncer allows the player to remove any one opponents chip from game board except a chip that has been placed in an already completed run.

212382.name: Yangtze
212382.description:
In Yangtze, players are distributors on the Yangtze River, with each trying to make the most money there.

On a turn, a player can take two actions, first selling one or more bundles of goods, then possibly purchasing a commodity. Goods on the Yangtze become cheaper and cheaper the further that they drift towards Shanghai. Whoever can wait a long time gets a chance to buy goods at a bargain price — assuming that another trader doesn't snatch those goods away first!

Players don't need to rely solely on trade, however. They can also establish business branches that give them advantages during play, in addition to the half-dozen special cards that every player holds at the start of play.

212383.name: Druid Spells IV (PRD)
212383.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level druid spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

212384.name: Druid Spells IV (3PP)
212384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Druid Spells is a simple document that collects the druid spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 4th-level druid spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

212385.name: Equipment Maker Volume 2: Blades
212385.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone who goes on an adventure uses equipment. Without it, their adventuring days would come to a halt quite quickly.

This generator doesn’t give you the details of any powers or abilities that are named or generated, that part is left up to you. It could simply be a description or the names could have real abilities tied to them.

This edition of Equipment Maker covers bladed weapons, from the humble dagger to the mighty claymore. Bladed weapons are probably the most common used, or the most popular weapons that adventurers and common folk use.

Although some would argue that weapons like axes or picks would also be classed as a bladed weapon, they will be featured in their own volume.

The tables inside cover...

Descriptor (d100 table)
Material (d100 table, with repeating options)
Blade Type (d100 table, with repeating options)
Power/Effect - Prefix (d100 table)
Power/Effect – Suffix (d100 table)




Plus, there are extra tables to help flesh out the equipments description, such as...

Accents and Adornments
Blade Shape/Features
Finish
Hand Guard – Material
Hand Guard – Shape
Handle Materials
Handle Shapes/Features
Inlay
Pommel Materials
Pommel Shapes/Features
Quick Blade Type

212386.name: Goblins of the Faerie Wood
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
212386.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dare You Enter the Enchanted Wood of the Goblins?

Lo, the enchanted forest wherein lives the goblins and faeries beckons… will you heed the call? Now you can, with Purple Duck Games’ Campaign Elements 8: Goblins of the Faerie Wood for Dungeon Crawl Classics! Whether “questing for it”, seeking enigmatic items like the weird of Sorthal, or just stumbling into a thin wall between The Lands We Know and the World of Faerie, entering the Faerie Wood of the Goblins will be a memorable experience. Your DCC players can meet King Ifhane of the Red Hoods, roam the Goblin Field and sample its wares, ask dangerous questions of the Gray Ones, or seek the advice of the Ogre Sorcerer… al at their peril!

CE 8: Goblins of the Faerie Wood is suitable for a 0-level funnel for goblin characters- using an exciting appendix for creating goblin adventurers who can be stealthy warriors or tricksome witch doctors, adding a new exciting option for your DCC gaming. With six detailed encounter areas, lots of interesting twists and turns, get your copy of CE 8: Goblins of the Faerie Wood from the goblinoid good-guys at Purple Duck Games- where our games are what you want!

212387.name: The Secret of Sapphire Lake
212387.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one shot Savage Worlds horror adventure

Invited to Sapphire Lake for the weekend five teens find that everything isn't normal from the strange fog to the creepy caretaker who lives in the next cabin.

boardgamehonor: 2017 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Nominee
212388.name: Animouv
212388.description:
Animouv is a children´s game of moves and strategy!
The object is to win animal cards. To do so, the players move the animal counters across the board to line up the animals present on their cards. But it's not so easy to line up animals without other players interfering...

212389.name: Against the Axis
212389.description:
From publisher blurb:

Against the Axis is a WW2 era superhero RPG supplement written by gaming luminary Steve Perrin for ICONS. It's set in the Stark City campaign setting - but Stark City is not required.

212390.name: Halloween Treats
212390.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halloween Treats is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the terrible tricks that desperate heroes and vile villains alike might unleash in a horror-themed campaign using the new Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Horror Adventures rulebook. This PDF, though, is more about treats than tricks, so while it does provide the new ghost rider and headless horseman mythic path abilities, it is more about whimsically wicked magic items for your heroes to find on this haunted holiday and use all year long, including the ghostly gossamer, goblin mask, witch's broom, and the legendary sack of gluttony!

212391.name: Red Throne 2
212391.description:
From publisher blurb:

From publisher blurb:

Six Spectacular Mythic Monsters for your AP!

Mythic Module Monsters: Red Throne 1 brings you mythic versions of all six monsters in the bestiary section of issue #2 in the official Red Throne AP:

giant fly
giant maggot
daughter of the dead
leukodaemon
lawgiver
nosferatu

212392.name: Finn McCool The Giant's Causeway Game
212392.description: Played on a hexagonal board with 19 hexagonal positions. Players alternate placing one of their pieces. The goal of the game is to make 4 in a row of your own game pieces. There are 2 types of game pieces, similar to X's and O's, and each player has 9 game pieces. A draw is possible.

212393.name: The Chalice of Shadows
212393.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bounty hunter is hot on the trail of a stolen item: the legendary Chalice of Shadows. But who could have stolen such a thing? The infamous leader of the land's largest and most successful death cult! What will he do now? Who will he turn to? Who can stop the death cultists?

212394.name: The Chalice of Shadows
212394.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bounty hunter is hot on the trail of a stolen item: the legendary Chalice of Shadows. But who could have stolen such a thing? The infamous leader of the land's largest and most successful death cult! What will he do now? Who will he turn to? Who can stop the death cultists?

212395.name: Meridian
212395.description: There are journeys that instill in us a sense of wonder and magic, stories that take us through worlds of imagination and sensual evocation. Whether it’s Atreyu or Bastian making their way through Phantasia, Alice exploring the Wonderland, Helena traversing the Cities of Light and Shadow, Ink trying to reach the headquarters of the Incubi, or Sarah finding her way through the Labyrinth of the Goblin King, their journey is always the heart of their story. Meridian will enable you and two or more of your friends to create your own such accounts. It gives you an ever-shifting map and a magical carriage, but you make each journey unique.

212396.name: The Divided House and Other Stories
rpg: The Divided House and Other Stories
212396.description:
A Narrative Entertainment

From the introduction:

There are dimensions other than this one. It is said that on Halloween night, the walls between worlds are thin. As October comes to a close, other realities permeate into ours. This is a story about a place that exists between two worlds. Over the course of a year, the two realities bleed into each other, producing preternatural effects. As the residents slowly discovered, the worlds on the other side are rarely hospitable to human existence.

212397.name: The Sin-Eater
